question_text: A 40-year-old woman experiences temperature-dependent episodic finger pain. She has no other medical problems.Hand findings are shown.
question_stem: Which of the following is the most likely diagnosis?
critique: The most likely diagnosis is primary Raynaud phenomenon (Option D). The hands are the most likely sites for the episodes of vasospasm that characterize Raynaud phenomenon. A typical episode is precipitated by cold exposure, which is soon followed by distinctive color changes of white (ischemic phase) or blue (cyanotic phase). Redness occurs with rewarming, indicating reperfusion.
